Future State of Architecture

2024-06-18T11:00:00Z

Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

That's a question we dread to be asked in interviews, but this time we asked it to our dear Back Market architecture. Without a doubt, our current stack has gotten us this far on the journey but we're also feeling some growing pains.

In this talk, we'll try to review what these pains are, what tradeoffs we intend to make along the way to our vision for the next phase of Back Market.

Architecture is constantly evolving to balance some pros and cons and we'll be counting on you to keep evolving this vision as well.

Florent JABY (Floby ðŸ’œ)

I've been a Staff Engineer at Back Market for 18 months now! During my career so far i've been lucky enough to make a lot of mistakes in a lot of various contexts, usually around web oriented architectures because I'm a firm believer in the Open Web and libre software in general.

These mistakes have led me to believe that they're a part of the job and that we can only hope to make more of them, but smaller, more frequently and in a controlled way.

If you approach me to chat, I can rave about software crafting, lean and agility, all colours as long as they're purple, why I hate dolphins or why Beatles > Stones.

Florian VALEYE
